title: prod(input, dim) gives ambiguous BoxTensor error
body_html:
from torch.autograd import Variable
s = autograd.Variable(torch.ones(1, 2), requires_grad=True)
prod = s.prod(1)
prod.backward()

torch/autograd/_functions/reduce.py in backward(ctx, grad_output)
     72             total_zeros = slice_zero_count.sum()
     73             grad_input = grad_output.mul(output).expand_as(input).div(input)
---> 74             if total_zeros == 0:
     75                 return grad_input, None, None
     76 

torch/autograd/variable.py in __bool__(self)
    119             return False
    120         raise RuntimeError("bool value of Variable objects containing non-empty " +
--> 121                            torch.typename(self.data) + " is ambiguous")
    122 
    123     __nonzero__ = __bool__

RuntimeError: bool value of Variable objects containing non-empty torch.ByteTensor is ambiguous

body:
```
from torch.autograd import Variable
s = autograd.Variable(torch.ones(1, 2), requires_grad=True)
prod = s.prod(1)
prod.backward()
```

     73             grad_input = grad_output.mul(output).expand_as(input).div(input)
---> 74             if total_zeros == 0:
     75                 return grad_input, None, None
